algorithm: {A novel hybrid local search operator that combines a dynamic segment relocation with a Pareto-guided edge replacement strategy to generate diverse high-quality neighbors while maintaining feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (x[1][0] + x[1][1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()

    n = len(base_solution)
    if n <= 3:
        return new_solution

    # Dynamic segment relocation
    seg_size = max(2, min(4, n // 4))
    a = np.random.randint(0, n - seg_size)
    b = a + seg_size - 1
    segment = new_solution[a:b+1]

    # Insert segment at a new position
    new_pos = np.random.randint(0, n - seg_size)
    new_solution = np.concatenate([
        new_solution[:new_pos],
        segment,
        new_solution[new_pos:a],
        new_solution[b+1:]
    ])

    # Pareto-guided edge replacement
    for i in range(n):
        j = (i + 1) % n
        k = (i + 2) % n

        current_cost1 = distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[j]]
        current_cost2 = distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[j]]
        new_cost1 = distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[k]]
        new_cost2 = distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[k]]

        if (new_cost1 < current_cost1 and new_cost2 <= current_cost2) or \
           (new_cost1 <= current_cost1 and new_cost2 < current_cost2):
            new_solution[j], new_solution[k] = new_solution[k], new_solution[j]

    # Random edge flip for diversity
    if np.random.rand() < 0.15:
        p, q = np.random.choice(n, 2, replace=False)
        if p > q:
            p, q = q, p
        new_solution[p:q+1] = np.flip(new_solution[p:q+1])

    return new_solution

algorithm: {This algorithm intelligently selects a solution from the archive based on both objective quality and diversity, then applies a novel hybrid local search combining adaptive segment rotation, guided edge reversal, and probabilistic node insertion to generate high-quality neighbors while ensuring feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    if len(archive) > 1:
        # Select solutions based on both quality and diversity
        objectives = np.array([obj for _, obj in archive])
        quality_weights = np.exp(-np.sum(objectives, axis=1))
        quality_weights = quality_weights / np.sum(quality_weights)
        selected_idx = np.random.choice(len(archive), p=quality_weights)
    else:
        selected_idx = 0

    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    if n > 3:
        # Adaptive segment rotation
        seg_size = max(3, min(7, n // 4))
        a = np.random.randint(0, n - seg_size)
        segment = new_solution[a:a+seg_size]

        # Rotate segment by random amount
        rot_amount = np.random.randint(1, seg_size)
        rotated_segment = np.roll(segment, rot_amount)
        new_solution[a:a+seg_size] = rotated_segment

        # Guided edge reversal
        for i in range(n):
            j = (i + 1) % n
            k = (i + 2) % n

            current_cost1 = distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[j]] + distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[k]]
            current_cost2 = distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[j]] + distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[k]]

            # Reverse the edge
            reversed_cost1 = distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[k]] + distance_matrix_1[new_solution[k], new_solution[j]]
            reversed_cost2 = distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[k]] + distance_matrix_2[new_solution[k], new_solution[j]]

            if (reversed_cost1 < current_cost1 and reversed_cost2 < current_cost2) or \
               (np.random.rand() < 0.3 and (reversed_cost1 <= current_cost1 or reversed_cost2 <= current_cost2)):
                new_solution[j], new_solution[k] = new_solution[k], new_solution[j]

        # Probabilistic node insertion
        if np.random.rand() < 0.2:
            node = np.random.choice(new_solution)
            pos = np.random.randint(0, n)
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, np.where(new_solution == node)[0][0])
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, pos, node)

    return new_solution

algorithm: {The new algorithm selects a solution from the archive based on a combination of objective values and diversity, then applies a hybrid local search combining adaptive segment rotation with guided edge swapping to generate a neighbor solution while ensuring feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    if not archive:
        raise ValueError("Archive is empty")

    # Select a solution with high potential for improvement
    objectives = np.array([obj for _, obj in archive])
    normalized_obj = (objectives - objectives.min(axis=0)) / (objectives.max(axis=0) - objectives.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    diversity_scores = np.array([np.sum(np.abs(objectives - obj)) for obj in objectives])
    combined_scores = 0.7 * normalized_obj[:, 0] + 0.3 * diversity_scores
    selected_idx = np.random.choice(len(archive), p=combined_scores / np.sum(combined_scores))
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search operator
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Step 1: Adaptive segment rotation
    segment_length = min(4, n // 3)
    start = np.random.randint(0, n - segment_length)
    end = start + segment_length
    rotation = np.random.randint(1, segment_length)
    new_solution[start:end] = np.roll(new_solution[start:end], rotation)

    # Step 2: Guided edge swapping
    i = np.random.randint(0, n - 1)
    j = np.random.randint(i + 1, n)
    if (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[i+1]] + distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%n]]) > \
       (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[j]] + distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i+1], new_solution[(j+1)%n]]):
        new_solution[i+1:j+1] = new_solution[i+1:j+1][::-1]

    # Ensure the solution remains a valid tour
    if len(np.unique(new_solution)) != n:
        # Fallback to simple swap if rotation breaks the tour
        new_solution = base_solution.copy()
        i = np.random.randint(0, n)
        j = np.random.randint(0, n)
        while j == i:
            j = np.random.randint(0, n)
        new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    return new_solution

algorithm: {This algorithm selects a solution from the archive using a weighted score combining normalized objective values and solution diversity, then applies a hybrid local search with adaptive segment reversal and guided node repositioning with different parameter settings to generate a neighbor solution while ensuring feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    if not archive:
        raise ValueError("Archive is empty")

    objectives = np.array([obj for _, obj in archive])
    normalized_obj = (objectives - objectives.min(axis=0)) / (objectives.max(axis=0) - objectives.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    scores = 0.7 * normalized_obj[:, 0] + 0.3 * normalized_obj[:, 1]
    selected_idx = np.random.choice(len(archive), p=scores / scores.sum())
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    segment_length = min(7, n // 3)
    start = np.random.randint(0, n - segment_length)
    end = start + segment_length
    new_solution[start:end] = new_solution[start:end][::-1]

    i = np.random.randint(0, n)
    j = np.random.randint(0, n)
    while j == i or j == (i + 1) % n or j == (i - 1) % n:
        j = np.random.randint(0, n)
    node_to_move = new_solution[i]
    new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], new_solution[i+1:j], [node_to_move], new_solution[j:]])

    if len(np.unique(new_solution)) != n:
        new_solution = base_solution.copy()
        i, j = np.random.choice(n, 2, replace=False)
        new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    return new_solution

algorithm: {This new algorithm selects a solution from the archive based on its potential for improvement in both objectives, then applies a novel hybrid local search combining adaptive node relocation and constrained edge swapping to generate a neighbor solution while ensuring feasibility, using a dynamic evaluation of improvement potential across both objectives.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    if not archive:
        raise ValueError("Archive is empty")

    # Select solution with highest potential for improvement in both objectives
    objectives = np.array([obj for _, obj in archive])
    improvement_potential = (objectives.max(axis=0) - objectives) / (objectives.max(axis=0) - objectives.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    scores = 0.6 * improvement_potential[:, 0] + 0.4 * improvement_potential[:, 1]
    selected_idx = np.random.choice(len(archive), p=scores / scores.sum())
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive node relocation
    relocate_length = min(3, n // 4)
    start = np.random.randint(0, n - relocate_length)
    segment = new_solution[start:start+relocate_length]
    new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:start], new_solution[start+relocate_length:], segment])

    # Constrained edge swapping
    for i in range(n):
        j = (i + 1) % n
        k = (i + 2) % n

        # Calculate current and potential new edges
        current_edge1 = distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[j]]
        current_edge2 = distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[j]]
        new_edge1 = distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[k]]
        new_edge2 = distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[k]]

        # Swap if beneficial for both objectives or with probability
        if (new_edge1 < current_edge1 and new_edge2 < current_edge2) or \
           (np.random.rand() < 0.2 and (new_edge1 <= current_edge1 or new_edge2 <= current_edge2)):
            new_solution[j], new_solution[k] = new_solution[k], new_solution[j]

    # Ensure feasibility
    if len(np.unique(new_solution)) != n:
        new_solution = base_solution.copy()
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(n, 2, replace=False))
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.flip(new_solution[a:b+1])

    return new_solution

algorithm: {This algorithm selects a solution from the archive using a weighted score combining normalized objective values and diversity, then applies a hybrid local search with adaptive segment reversal and guided node repositioning to generate a neighbor solution while ensuring feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    if not archive:
        raise ValueError("Archive is empty")

    # Select a solution with high potential for improvement using different parameter settings
    objectives = np.array([obj for _, obj in archive])
    normalized_obj = (objectives - objectives.min(axis=0)) / (objectives.max(axis=0) - objectives.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    scores = 0.4 * normalized_obj[:, 0] + 0.6 * normalized_obj[:, 1]
    selected_idx = np.random.choice(len(archive), p=scores / scores.sum())
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search operator with different parameters
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Step 1: Adaptive segment reversal with different segment length
    segment_length = min(5, n // 2)
    start = np.random.randint(0, n - segment_length)
    end = start + segment_length
    new_solution[start:end] = new_solution[start:end][::-1]

    # Step 2: Guided node repositioning with different selection criteria
    i = np.random.randint(0, n)
    j = np.random.randint(0, n)
    while j == i or j == (i + 1) % n or j == (i - 1) % n:
        j = np.random.randint(0, n)
    node_to_move = new_solution[i]
    new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], new_solution[i+1:j], [node_to_move], new_solution[j:]])

    # Ensure the solution remains a valid tour
    if len(np.unique(new_solution)) != n:
        # Fallback to simple swap if repositioning breaks the tour
        new_solution = base_solution.copy()
        i, j = np.random.choice(n, 2, replace=False)
        new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    if not archive:
        raise ValueError("Archive is empty")

    objectives = np.array([obj for _, obj in archive])
    normalized_obj = (objectives - objectives.min(axis=0)) / (objectives.max(axis=0) - objectives.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    scores = 0.5 * normalized_obj[:, 0] + 0.5 * normalized_obj[:, 1]
    selected_idx = np.random.choice(len(archive), p=scores / scores.sum())
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    segment_length = min(5, n // 2)
    start = np.random.randint(0, n - segment_length)
    end = start + segment_length
    new_solution[start:end] = new_solution[start:end][::-1]

    i = np.random.randint(0, n)
    j = np.random.randint(0, n)
    while j == i or j == (i + 1) % n or j == (i - 1) % n:
        j = np.random.randint(0, n)
    node_to_move = new_solution[i]
    new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], new_solution[i+1:j], [node_to_move], new_solution[j:]])

    if len(np.unique(new_solution)) != n:
        new_solution = base_solution.copy()
        i, j = np.random.choice(n, 2, replace=False)
        new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    return new_solution

algorithm: {A novel hybrid local search operator that intelligently selects promising solutions from the archive, combines a randomized segment inversion with a guided edge exchange strategy to generate high-quality neighbors while ensuring feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    selected_idx = np.random.choice(len(archive))
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()

    n = len(base_solution)
    if n <= 3:
        return new_solution

    # Random segment inversion with adaptive segment size
    seg_size = min(5, n // 3)
    a = np.random.randint(0, n - seg_size)
    b = a + seg_size - 1
    new_solution[a:b+1] = np.flip(new_solution[a:b+1])

    # Guided edge exchange with adaptive selection
    for i in range(n):
        j = (i + 1) % n
        k = (i + 2) % n

        current_edge1 = distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[j]]
        current_edge2 = distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[j]]
        new_edge1 = distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[k]]
        new_edge2 = distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[k]]

        # Adaptive acceptance criteria
        if (new_edge1 < current_edge1 and new_edge2 < current_edge2) or \
           (np.random.rand() < 0.2 * (1 - (i / n)) and (new_edge1 <= current_edge1 or new_edge2 <= current_edge2)):
            new_solution[j], new_solution[k] = new_solution[k], new_solution[j]

    # Additional random swap to increase diversity
    if np.random.rand() < 0.1:
        p, q = np.random.choice(n, 2, replace=False)
        new_solution[p], new_solution[q] = new_solution[q], new_solution[p]

    return new_solution

algorithm: {The heuristic function selects a solution from the archive based on a combination of objective diversity and potential for improvement, then applies a hybrid local search combining edge exchange and insertion moves to generate a neighbor solution while ensuring feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    if len(archive) > 1:
        # Sort solutions by the sum of objectives (ascending) to prioritize better solutions
        sorted_archive = sorted(archive, key=lambda x: sum(x[1]))
        # Select top 30% solutions for consideration
        top_solutions = sorted_archive[:max(1, len(sorted_archive) // 3)]
        # Randomly select one from the top solutions
        selected = random.choice(top_solutions)
    else:
        selected = archive[0]

    base_solution = selected[0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()

    # Apply hybrid local search: edge exchange and insertion
    n = len(new_solution)
    if n > 3:
        # Randomly select two non-adjacent edges to exchange
        i = random.randint(0, n-2)
        j = random.randint(i+2, n-1) if i+2 < n-1 else n-1

        # Perform edge exchange
        new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

        # Randomly select a node to reinsert
        k = random.randint(0, n-1)
        node = new_solution[k]

        # Remove the node and reinsert it at a random position
        new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, k)
        pos = random.randint(0, n-2)
        new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, pos, node)

    return new_solution

algorithm: {A novel hybrid local search operator that intelligently selects promising solutions from the archive, combines a randomized segment inversion with a guided edge exchange strategy to generate high-quality neighbors while ensuring feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    selected_idx = np.random.choice(len(archive))
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()

    n = len(base_solution)
    if n <= 3:
        return new_solution

    # Random segment inversion with adaptive segment size
    seg_size = min(5, n // 3)
    a = np.random.randint(0, n - seg_size)
    b = a + seg_size - 1
    new_solution[a:b+1] = np.flip(new_solution[a:b+1])

    # Guided edge exchange with adaptive selection
    for i in range(n):
        j = (i + 1) % n
        k = (i + 2) % n

        current_edge1 = distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[j]]
        current_edge2 = distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[j]]
        new_edge1 = distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[k]]
        new_edge2 = distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[k]]

        # Adaptive acceptance criteria
        if (new_edge1 < current_edge1 and new_edge2 < current_edge2) or \
           (np.random.rand() < 0.2 * (1 - (i / n)) and (new_edge1 <= current_edge1 or new_edge2 <= current_edge2)):
            new_solution[j], new_solution[k] = new_solution[k], new_solution[j]

    # Additional random swap to increase diversity
    if np.random.rand() < 0.1:
        p, q = np.random.choice(n, 2, replace=False)
        new_solution[p], new_solution[q] = new_solution[q], new_solution[p]

    return new_solution
